name: Sprout Video Downloader
tagline: Save Sprout videos instantly for offline viewing.
description:
Sprout Video Downloader captures videos hosted on sproutvideo.com as well as embedded players inside private portals, courses, and documentation. It detects the player, lists every available quality, and converts hosted streams into MP4 files you can store offline without juggling ffmpeg or manual URL scraping.

Stay logged in to your SproutVideo account, choose the resolution you need, and the extension forwards authentication headers, downloads each segment, and merges them quietly in the background while you continue working.
seo_title: Sprout Video Downloader | Download Sprout Videos
seo_description: Download Sprout videos easily for offline viewing. Fast, reliable Sprout video downloader with high-quality downloads.

features: Detects SproutVideo players on sproutvideo.com and embedded on third-party sites
Uses your active session to access gated or private videos securely
Converts HLS playlists into MP4 files while preserving source quality
Lists all available resolutions with estimated file sizes and remembers your choice
Displays segment counts, progress, and speed so you know exactly what’s happening
Supports Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Brave, and Opera on desktop
Stores licence data locally with no analytics or remote tracking

pricing.label: One-time payment
pricing.note: Lifetime licence covering embed detection, authentication forwarding, and stream conversion. Sales are final.
benefits: Archive SproutVideo lessons and client assets before access changes
Keep offline copies for travel, compliance, or editing without buffering
Maintain privacy with all processing performed locally on your device

faqs.question: How do I download a SproutVideo recording with this extension?
faqs.answer: Open the page containing the SproutVideo player, click the downloader icon, pick your desired resolution, and keep the tab open while the segment counter completes. The MP4 will save automatically.

faqs.question: Does it work with embedded players on course or membership sites?
faqs.answer: Yes. The extension detects embedded SproutVideo players anywhere on the web and handles them exactly like the main site.

faqs.question: Will it download private or password-protected videos?
faqs.answer: If you can watch the video while logged into SproutVideo or the host site, the downloader uses that session to access and save the stream. It does not bypass access you do not already have.

faqs.question: Which browsers are supported?
faqs.answer: Builds are available for Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Brave, and Opera on Windows, macOS, and Linux desktops.

faqs.question: Are captions or transcripts included?
faqs.answer: The downloader focuses on video and audio. Captions, transcripts, or attachments should be saved separately from within SproutVideo.

faqs.question: What happens if I refresh the page mid-download?
faqs.answer: Progress persists. As long as the original tab remains open, the downloader resumes from the last segment and finishes the MP4.

faqs.question: Is my data private?
faqs.answer: All detection and conversion happen locally on your computer. Only licence verification touches remote servers, and no viewing history is collected.

reviews.name: Avery McLean
reviews.review: Our training portal uses SproutVideo embeds. This extension detects them instantly and delivers perfect MP4s for offline study.
reviews.title: Embedded course videos now portable

reviews.name: Simone Laurent
reviews.review: Logged in with my client account and every private video downloaded without extra setup. Segment progress kept me informed the whole time.
reviews.title: Handles protected content smoothly

reviews.name: Trent Howard
reviews.review: Even long webinars merge cleanly. I can queue the next lesson as soon as the bar hits 100%.
reviews.title: Reliable conversions

permission_justifications.justification:
Saves the merged MP4 to your downloads folder and keeps the progress tracker
in sync for each recording.

Detects SproutVideo players on the current tab—whether on sproutvideo.com or
embedded elsewhere—and injects the download controls.

Allows downloads to continue if you refresh or open another lesson and restores
the status window when you return.

Extracts stream manifests, variant data, and authentication headers from the
player so the downloader can fetch the correct segments.

Merges HLS segments into MP4 files in the background, preventing the browser
UI from freezing during long downloads.
